title: Singaporean boy, 14, who simulated ISIS terror attacks on Roblox issued ISA restriction order
desc: SINGAPORE - A 14-year-old Singaporean boy who aspired to travel overseas to conduct armed violence and die a martyr has been issued a restriction order (RO) under the Internal Security Act (ISA).

title: LTA's new OBU alerts for safer roads
desc: LTA introduces new OBU alerts to notify motorists to slow down near certain streets and expressway exits, enhancing road safety. Read more at straitstimes.com.

title: Chinese ambassador hints at retaliation if Port of Darwin is returned to Australian control
desc: China's ambassador to Australia, Xiao Qian, questions the Albanese government's ethics in wanting to return the Port of Darwin to Australian hands.

title: Zanzibar strengthens routine AMR surveillance and reporting
desc: The World Health Organization (WHO) is building a better future for people everywhere. Health lays the foundation for vibrant and productive communities, stronger economies, safer nations and a better world. Our work touches lives around the world every day – often in invisible ways. As the lead health authority within the United Nations (UN) system, we help ensure the safety of the air we breathe, the food we eat, the water we drink and the medicines and vaccines that treat and protect us. The Organization aims to provide every child, woman and man with the best chance to lead a healthier, longer life.

title: These Are The 18 Most Romantic Restaurants In Victoria For 2026, According To Over 175,000 Diners From OpenTable
desc: The team at OpenTable has crunched the numbers to reveal the Top 50 Romantic Restaurants in Australia, and 18 Victorian venues made the list.

title: Consumers say tipping becoming 'less voluntary'
desc: Two thirds of consumers believe tipping is becoming "less voluntary", according to new research from the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission.
